intro: Tarenna peteri, commonly known as the Madagascar tarenna, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, round berries. Tarenna peteri is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments.
